'''Leslie Johnson''' (June 20, 1933 â€“ August 22, 2018), known as '''Lazy Lester''', was an American [[blues]] musician who sang and played the harmonica and guitar. In a career spanning the 1950s to 2018, he pioneered [[swamp blues]], and also played [[harmonica blues]], [[rhythm and blues]] and [[Louisiana blues]].

Best known for regional hits recorded with Ernie Young's [[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]]-based [[Excello Records]], Lester also contributed to songs recorded by other Excello artists, including [[Slim Harpo]], [[Lightnin' Slim]], and [[Katie Webster]]. Cover versions of his songs have been recorded by (among others) the [[The Kinks|Kinks]], the [[Flamin' Groovies]], [[Freddy Fender]], [[Dwight Yoakam]], [[Dave Edmunds]], [[Raful Neal]], [[Anson Funderburgh]], and the [[The Fabulous Thunderbirds|Fabulous Thunderbirds]]. In the comeback stage of his career (since the late 1980s), he recorded new albums backed by [[Mike Buck (musician)|Mike Buck]], [[Sue Foley]], [[Gene Taylor (pianist)|Gene Taylor]], [[Kenny Neal]], [[Lucky Peterson]], and [[Jimmie Vaughan]].
